TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit RC2 extends System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Represents the base class from which all implementations of the RC2 algorithm must derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > A newer symmetric encryption algorithm, Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), is available. Consider using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Aes> algorithm and its derived classes instead of the RC2 class. Use RC2 only for compatibility with legacy applications and data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks You cannot create an instance of an abstract class. Application code will create a new instance of a derived class.
This algorithm supports key lengths from 40 bits to 1024 bits in increments of 8 bits, but the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RC2CryptoServiceProvider> implementation only supports key lengths from 40 bits to 128 bits in increments of 8 bits.
This method initializes the protected fields of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm> to the default values listed in the following table.
|Field|Default Value| |-----------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.KeySizeValue>|128| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.BlockSizeValue>|64| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.FeedbackSizeValue>|64|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.RC2 Create() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of a cryptographic object to perform the algorithm.
Docs.returns: An instance of a cryptographic object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create an instance of the RC2 class that you can use to encrypt and decrypt data.
## Examples The following example shows how to create and use an RC2 object to encrypt and decrypt data in a file.
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.RC2.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_46_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Cryptography.RC2.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_46_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.RC2.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_46_1.vb)]
The following example shows how to create and use an RC2 object to encrypt and decrypt data in memory.
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.RC2.Create.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_46_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[Cryptography.RC2.Create.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_46_2.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.RC2.Create.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_46_2.vb)]

Docs.exception: The algorithm was used with Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) mode enabled, but is not FIPS compatible.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.RC2 Create(string AlgName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the specific implementation of to use.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of a cryptographic object to perform the specified implementation of the algorithm.
Docs.returns: An instance of a cryptographic object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create an instance of the RC2 class that you can use to encrypt and decrypt data.
## Examples The following example shows how to create and use an RC2 object to encrypt and decrypt data in a file.
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_6_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_6_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_6_1.vb)]
The following example shows how to create and use an RC2 object to encrypt and decrypt data in memory.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_6_2.cs)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_6_2.cpp)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.RC2.Createstring.Memory#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_6_2.vb)]

Docs.exception: The algorithm described by the parameter was used with Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) mode enabled, but is not FIPS compatible.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int EffectiveKeySize { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the effective size of the secret key used by the algorithm in bits.
Docs.value: The effective key size used by the algorithm.
Docs.exception: The effective key size is invalid.

Docs.summary: Represents the effective size of the secret key used by the algorithm in bits.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This field is accessed through the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RC2.EffectiveKeySize%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int KeySize { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the secret key used by the algorithm in bits.
Docs.value: The size of the secret key used by the algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This algorithm supports key lengths from 40 bits to 1024 bits in increments of 8 bits, but the RC2CryptoServiceProvider implementation only supports key lengths from 40 bits to 128 bits in increments of 8 bits.

Docs.exception: The value for the RC2 key size is less than the effective key size value.
